node.title: Alert fan's unique warning helps NHL team staffer nip cancer in bud
node.description: Vancouver Canucks assistant equipment manager Brian "Red" Hamilton was behind the bench at a game when he spotted a fan holding up her phone to show him a message that could have been life-saving.

node.title: CES 2022: "The show will and must go on"
node.description: Trends at this year's edition of the annual tech showcase include autonomous race cars,16K TVs and AI everywhere.

node.title: 200-million-year-old dinosaur footprints discovered on beach
node.description: Researchers believe that the area may have once been a trample ground in the Triassic period for sauropodomorphs — massive, herbivorous, long-necked dinosaurs.

node.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's personal Twitter account permanently suspended
node.description: Marjorie Taylor Greene has been suspended from Twitter, again. This time it is permanent, the social network said.

node.title: Biden tells Ukraine's president U.S. will act "decisively" if Russia invades
node.description: The president spoke with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky on Sunday amid heightening tensions in the region.

node.title: Gottlieb says Omicron appears to be a "milder strain" of COVID-19, but pediatric danger remains
node.description: Gottlieb also noted that places that have been hard hit early by Omicron are as soon as "two weeks away from peaking, but the rest of the country probably faces a hard month ahead of us."

node.title: Winter Storm Knocks Out Power Across Southeast
node.description: Hundreds of thousands were without electricity on Monday, and federal government offices in the Washington, D.C., area were closed because of the storm.

node.title: Missing teens rescued by Coast Guard after writing "SOS" in snow
node.description: The Coast Guard released video of the rescue, showing one of the hikers being hoisted into a helicopter.

node.title: Man bought Lamborghini, Rolex, more with COVID funds, feds say
node.description: Federal prosecutors say Valesky Barosy, 27, of Fort Lauderdale, Florida used COVID-19 relief money to buy $2.2 million in luxury items such as a Lamborghini and Rolex watches.

node.title: Online ‘Auction’ Is Latest Attack on Muslim Women in India
node.description: The fake site, the second in months, is a sign of the organized nature of virtual bullying, with threats of sexualized violence aimed at silencing the outspoken.

node.title: How Beijing Has Muted Hong Kong’s Independent Media
node.description: Citizen News, a small but aggressive online publication, is the latest outlet to fold amid relentless pressure from the authorities.

node.title: 2 women choke to death on New Year's rice cakes
node.description: Every year, Japan issues public warnings to be careful when eating mochi -- and nearly every year, people choke to death anyway.

node.title: President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil Is Hospitalized, Local Reports Say
node.description: Mr. Bolsonaro has previously undergone surgeries related to serious stabbing wounds he suffered while on the campaign trail in 2018.

node.title: "No worries" and "circle back" among annual list of banished phrases
node.description: There are only three entries associated with the pandemic this year after it dominated last year's list.

node.title: More U.S. flights grounded after some 5,000 weekend cancellations
node.description: Carriers blame bad weather and COVID-caused crew shortages for frustrating holiday travelers' trips home.

node.title: Capitol Police chief warns threat level is "much higher" than a year ago
node.description: Tom Manger said the department has addressed areas such as planning for big demonstrations, intelligence gathering and making sure officers have the training and equipment they need.

node.title: Winter storm system moving up East Coast for year's first workday
node.description: It's already prompted officials to close federal offices in D.C. and COVID testing and vaccination sites in Maryland and Virginia. Airports coping with thousands of weekend flight cancellations were sure to see more.

node.title: Taiwanese-Born Best Friends Endure a California Adolescence, Side by Side
node.description: Jean Chen Ho’s debut story collection, “Fiona and Jane,” follows all the milestones of growing up for immigrants in America.

node.title: The Ghost Wolves of Galveston Island
node.description: A population of strange canids in Texas could hold the key to reviving the highly endangered red wolf.

node.title: An Evangelical Climate Scientist Wonders What Went Wrong
node.description: Katharine Hayhoe doesn’t see the love in many of her fellow Christians. She still has hope we can all do better.

node.title: For One Rockaways Couple, Lockdown Was a Creative Windfall
node.description: While many hoped to use the enforced isolation of quarantine creatively, the couple who started Locus of Occult actually did.

node.title: Language Mistake in Georgia Death Penalty Law Creates a Daunting Hurdle
node.description: The Supreme Court will decide whether to hear a challenge to the law, which requires that defendants in capital cases who are intellectually disabled prove it “beyond a reasonable doubt” — a phrase that was inserted in error.

node.title: How the E.U. Allowed Hungary to Become an Illiberal Model
node.description: After years of complacency and wishful thinking, Brussels is finally trying to rein in the country’s pugnacious leader, Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

node.title: Celebrating the ‘Great Night of Shiva’ in Kathmandu
node.description: Every year, thousands of celebrants gather at a temple complex in Nepal’s capital in honor of Shiva, one of Hinduism’s most revered gods.

node.title: Search on for swimmer missing in Waikato River
node.description: Police say emergency services received a report of a missing swimmer shortly after 6pm.

node.title: 'Like possums': Auckland bans sale of invasive turtles after unprepared pet owners dump them in wild
node.description: "We could do well to be removing that threat while we still have the chance."

node.title: COVID updates: 84 million rapid antigen tests ordered for close contacts
node.description: Here's a quick wrap of what's happening in COVID news across Australia.

node.title: The secret U.S. unit that helped the Allies beat Hitler
node.description: The Ritchie Boys were responsible for gathering more than half the actionable intelligence on the battlefield during World War II. For the many German-born Jews in their ranks, defeating the Nazis was heartbreakingly personal.

node.title: Homicide investigation launched after baby's death
node.description: Police in Canterbury have launched a homicide investigation after a three-month-old baby with serious injuries died.

node.title: Why are mosquitoes attracted to some people more than others?
node.description: What makes someone more of a mozzie magnet than others? Scientists have been conducting some interesting experiments to find out. Here's what we know.
